title.value: Graph Fourier MMD for Signals on Graphs
title.justification: The title of the paper at the beginning of the document states this clearly.
title.quote: Graph Fourier MMD for Signals on Graphs

extractions.description: This paper introduces Graph Fourier Maximum Mean Discrepancy (GFMMD), a novel distance measure between distributions and signals on graphs, particularly useful for analyzing high-dimensional data modeled as graphs such as single-cell RNA-sequencing data. The study also discusses an efficient computational method for GFMMD and demonstrates its application in biological data analysis.

type.justification: The paper focuses on proposing a novel distance measure (GFMMD) and proving its properties rather than conducting empirical experiments to validate its effectiveness.
type.quote: We define Graph Fourier MMD as a distance between signals on arbitrary graphs, and prove that it is both an integrable probability metric and maximum mean discrepancy.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on methods and metrics related to graphs and signal processing on graphs, which falls under Graph-based Machine Learning.
name.quote: Our notion of MMD, that we call Graph Fourier MMD (GFMMD), is a distance between signals on a data graph that is found by analytically solving for an optimal witness function.

name.justification: The paper applies its theoretical contributions to analyze single cell RNA-sequencing data, a topic in biomedical signal processing.
name.quote: We show it on graph benchmark datasets as well as on single-cell RNA-sequencing data analysis.

name.justification: This is the novel method proposed as the primary contribution of the paper.
name.quote: We propose Graph Fourier MMD (GFMMD), a novel distance between distributions and signals on graphs.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced as a novel contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose Graph Fourier MMD (GFMMD), a novel distance between distributions and signals on graphs.

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions computational methods for GFMMD, implying that it was executed during the study.
is_executed.quote: We derive an exact analytical solution for GFMMD which can be approximated in O(n(log n + m2 )) time to calculate all pairwise-distances between distributions.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares GFMMD with other methods such as Earth Mover's Distance and Diffusion EMD.
is_compared.quote: We compare our method GFMMD to all three of these methods.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is a novel contribution of the paper and does not reference an external paper.

name.justification: The dataset is explicitly mentioned as used for single cell RNA-sequencing data analysis.
name.quote: To demonstrate the utility of Graph Fourier MMD for biological analysis, we leveraged publicly available single-cell RNA sequencing dataset of CD8-positive T cells (Zheng et al., 2017).

referenced_paper_title.value: Massively parallel digital transcriptional profiling of single cells
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper by Zhang et al. (2017) is cited in relation to the dataset used.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To demonstrate the utility of Graph Fourier MMD for biological analysis, we leveraged publicly available single-cell RNA sequencing dataset of CD8-positive T cells (Zheng et al., 2017).

name.justification: The library for graph signal processing mentioned in the reproducibility section.
name.quote: In the experiments, the main libraries which were used were pygsp to generate, store, and manipulate graphs.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Just referred to as 'pygsp'. No external reference is cited.
